meanings.definition: The act of converging or moving toward a common point.
meanings.sent1: The students' vergence towards the teacher showed their interest in the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The vergence of the roads led to a central square in the town.
meanings.sent3: The vergence of the ants towards the fallen crumbs was like a tiny parade.
meanings.sent4: The vergence of opinions in the meeting finally led to a decision.
meanings.sent5: The vergence of the riverbanks created a beautiful natural arch.

meanings.definition: The ability of the eyes to turn inward to focus on a near object.
meanings.sent1: Her vergence allowed her to read the tiny print on the medicine bottle.
meanings.sent2: The doctor tested the patient's vergence by asking them to look at their finger up close.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vergence on the moving toy was both cute and determined.
meanings.sent4: His vergence on the details of the painting revealed hidden symbols.
meanings.sent5: The vergence of the child's eyes as she examined the butterfly was pure wonder.

meanings.definition: The point at which two lines or paths meet or intersect.
meanings.sent1: The vergence of the roads was marked by a small signpost.
meanings.sent2: At the vergence of the hiking trails, hikers could choose different paths.
meanings.sent3: The vergence of the plot twists in the movie kept the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: The vergence of the storylines in the novel created a surprising climax.
meanings.sent5: The vergence of the train tracks in the distance looked like they merged into one.
